ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of <u>intellectual challenge</u> of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the <u>workload</u> of this course was:
Which of the following best describes your mode of learning in this course?
options: virtual seminar or other discussion format
in-person seminar or other discussion format

narratives.question_text:
What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: I learned so much about how to guide my own research, manage my own time, set deadlines and goals for myself, and to work with my advisor to complete my project.
learned the process of writing a thesis and what an expanded research projects needs to be executed properly
This thesis was incredibly hard to do but it was a great learning experience and  I think I gained several important field research skills along the way.

narratives.question_text:
What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: There arent really strengths or weaknesses, as this is a self-guided independent research and writing course. Prof Laguna is amazing as an essay coordinator however, and he made the experience so positive for me.

narratives.question_text: Among the practices in this course geared toward learning during the COVID-19 pandemic, which succeeded and which could be improved? Please comment on course practices that allowed for virtual engagement. (Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: the entire ER&M department, specifically Professor Laguna and Professor Mirakhor were extremely helpful and supportive in making sure, that despite all the pandemic challenges, I was able to finish my thesis
I did not get to travel for my thesis but I was able to successfully communicate with collaborators remotely.

narratives.question_text:
Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: Yes! The yearlong essay is certainly a lot of work, but its extremely rewarding and really fun. If you have something youve been wanting to go in-depth with over your time at Yale, then take this course and write a thesis!

Yes. I  think completing a thesis was instrumental in finalizing my Yale studies. I  learned a lot of skills along the way and was able to produce a piece of work I am quite proud of and I think is important information.

narratives.question_text: Please list any other mode(s) of learning, including any combination or variation of the above options.
comments: study halls/one on one adviser meetings
